clinical_study.brief_title: Continuous Control of Polyurethane Tracheal-cuff Pressure: Efficiency of a Pneumatic Device
clinical_study.official_title: Continuous Control of Polyurethane Tracheal-cuff Pressure: Efficiency of a Pneumatic Device

brief_summary.textblock: Underinflation and overinflation of tracheal cuff are common in intubated patients, including those intubated with polyurethane-cuffed tubes. The aim of this study is to determine the efficiency of a pneumatic device in controlling cuff pressure.

detailed_description.textblock: Underinflation and overinflation of tracheal cuff are associated with severe complications such as microaspiration of contaminated secretions, and tracheal ischemia. Efficient control of cuff pressure would probably allow reducing complications related to variations in cuff pressure.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients with underinflation or overinflation of cuff pressure
primary_outcome.description: Continuous recording of cuff pressure will be performed during 2 24-h periods (with or without the pneumatic device)

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of tracheal-cuff shape on variations in cuff pressure
secondary_outcome.description: Patients will be intubated with cylindrical or tapered polyurethane cuffed tubes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of continuous control of cuff pressure on microaspiration of gastric contents
secondary_outcome.description: Pepsin will be quantitatively measured in tracheal aspirates of all patients during the 2 24-h periods (with or without the pneumatic device)

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of tracheal cuff shape on microaspiration of gastric contents
secondary_outcome.description: Pepsin level in tracheal aspirates will be compared between patients intubated with cylindrical polyurethane cuffed-tubes versus those intubated with tapered polyurethane cuffed-tubes

arm_group.description: Intervention: continuous control of cuff pressure using a pneumatic device, tapered polyurethane cuff
Continuous control of cuff pressure using a pneumatic device in patients intubated with cylindrical polyurethane cuffed tracheal tubes
Routine care of cuff pressure using a manometer, tapered polyurethane cuff
Routine care of cuff pressure using a manometer, cylindrical polyurethane tracheal cuff

intervention.intervention_name: Pneumatic device, cylindrical or tapered cuff
intervention.description: Continuous control of cuff pressure using a pneumatic device (Nosten) Cylindrical (Kimberly Clark tube) or tapered (Covidien tube) tracheal cuff

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients requiring intubation in the ICU
- Predicted duration of mechanical ventilation > or = 48h
- Age > or = 18 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- Contraindication for semirecumbent position
- Contraindication for enteral nutrition
- Pregnancy
